name: 英美短篇小說天地
goals: 介紹英文短篇小說：說明西方短篇小說的歷史與特色。
閱讀名家代表作品：介紹西方著名作家的生平背景，增進學生對西洋作家的瞭解。
增進學生的英文能力: 藉由精細閱讀與討論，提昇同學的英文能力。

syllabus:
**Descriptions**

This course is designed to introduce to students the fundamental elements of short stories with a “problem-based learning” (PBL) pedagogy. Each week, the class activity centers on a problem in relation to the assigned reading for students to discuss and resolve in a group. In the second half of the semester, it will feature selected masterpieces of short stories. Overall, it aims to deliver literature via interactive learning environments such as group discussions, problem solving, video viewing, individual research, play and performance arts, etc. The goals are to get students familiar with the fundamental elements of the short story as a sub-genre of literature and interested in the making and delivering of a good story. Moreover, it provides students with the opportunity to collectively work on a short story and present the content in a most creative and technologically enhanced manner. Ultimately, it hopes to connect the reading of short stories with the delivery (telling) of a good story, underscoring the significance of storytelling in literature and in life.   

**Objectives**

To cultivate the appreciation of short stories, including history, features, and appreciation

To develop “problem-based learning” techniques in a group

To motivate students to work on language art in the creation of a good story with peers

To stimulate students to deliver the story in technologically-enhanced presentations

**Grouping and LINE Group**

The class will be grouped by 5 and please elect someone to be the Group Leader (GL). The leader of each group will join a LINE Group with Iping laoshi to help with class management.

**Teaching Assistant**

TOA

**Requirements**  
You are expected to come to class prepared! **Before** class, you should have done all readings, worked on homework and you should be able to participate fully in the discussions.

  
1) Attendance and Participation 10%

    Students are allowed only **one** absences in the semester (婚喪生理假等). If there are more than one, it will damage the assessment. (AàB+, B+àB, etc.)

2) Moodle Posts, “What’s Wrong with This Story?” 20%

    Weekly Moodle Posts: Students should come to class having read the story assigned for the week. Take the quiz, check the answers, discuss the story in group, and post a reflection on Moodle every week. This serves as your weekly Moodle journal. Each student should have a total of 12 posts. Weekly posts are mandatory and the teacher will check on the number of the posts by end of the semester.

3) Oral Presentation, 20%,

   Group oral presentation of the assigned story (with PPT)

4) Midterm Video, “Make It New” 20%

    This is a group project. Your project is to make an adaptation of any of the 7 assigned stories before midterm and make an adaptation video about it.

5) Final Exam, 30%

    Final exam (T/F, multiple choices, simple, and essay questions) will take place in the classroom. It will cover only the five stories after the midterm.

**Class Reader**

A xerox-copied class reader will be available at Zheng-de-heng (讚德行), the basement copy shop in the night market. Please purchase the reader on your own.
